__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ James Lee Woodford 3rd
Ph: 502-294-6739
539 Southwestern Parkway
LKouisville, 40211

DOB 9/8/1985
SSN: 005-84-9878

DOA 6/19/2025

Description: Was hit on rear driver side while crossing main street. Client was on Clay St going south crossing Main St. light turned green and he was tboned

LMPD
25070128

PIP KFB

08065806

Went to UofL Hospital downtown via EMS

__Person Making Contact:__ Justin
__Date & Time__: June 23 2025
episodes.natural_language:
Initial client contact on June 23, 2025, with Justin regarding the motor vehicle accident involving James Woodford. James Lee Woodford III, born September 8, 1985, can be reached at 502-294-6739 and resides at 539 Southwestern Parkway, Louisville, KY 40211. Social Security Number is redacted. Date of accident: June 19, 2025.

The description of the incident is that James was crossing Main Street while traveling south on Clay Street when the light turned green and he was hit on the rear driver’s side, i.e., a T-bone collision. Louisville Metro Police Department case number 25070128 is on file. The PIP policy is KFB, with claim number 08065806. He was transported to UofL Hospital downtown by EMS. Reported injuries include pain to the neck and back, a headache, and pain to the left shoulder/side.
episodes.author: Filevine Integration

episodes.original_body:
Case: James-Woodford-MVA-6-19-2025
Client: James Woodford

**FILE ORGANIZATION COMPLETED**

Completed comprehensive file organization using Case File Organization skill with 8-bucket system and content-based naming:

**Phase 1 - Inventory (Complete):**
- Generated file inventory of 25 files
- Scrambled 11 .md filenames to eliminate naming bias
- Created PDF-MD mapping for reunification
- Moved PDFs to temporary _pdf_originals/ folder

**Phase 2 - Analysis & Mapping (Complete):**
- Single sub-agent workflow (25 files < 40 threshold)
- Analyzed scrambled files based purely on content (no filename bias)
- Created comprehensive reorganization map for all 25 files
- Applied proper naming convention: YYYY-MM-DD - Client Name - Category - Originator - Description
- Identified 2 duplicate files for deletion
- Identified 1 outdated contacts.json for deletion

**Phase 3 - Quality Review (Complete):**
- Error rate: 14.3% (2 errors out of 14 files checked)
- Main agent corrected 2 date errors:
 * doc_0001.md: Fee Agreement date corrected from 2021-01-01 (template year) to 2025-06-24 (actual Vinesign signature date)
 * doc_0002.md: State Farm LOR date corrected from 2024-03-22 (source filename artifact) to 2025-07-24 (actual letter date)
- Verified duplicate detection: Both duplicates confirmed safe to delete
- Updated contacts.json handling: Root version marked for deletion (outdated, 6 entries vs 8 in Case Information version)

**Phase 4 - Execution (Complete):**
- Executed 15 file operations
- Moved 12 files (9 PDF+MD pairs, 3 DOCX files) to proper 8-bucket structure:
 * Client: 6 files (fee agreement, intake verification, termination letter)
 * Investigation: 2 files (police traffic collision report)
 * Insurance/BI/American Family: 4 files (LOR, claim denial)
 * Insurance/BI/State Farm: 4 files (LOR, claims acknowledgement)
 * Insurance/PIP/Kentucky Farm Bureau: 3 files (motor vehicle collision notice)
- Deleted 3 files (2 duplicate PDF+MD pairs, 1 outdated contacts.json)
- Reunified PDFs with .md companions using proper names
- Cleaned up temporary _pdf_originals/ folder

**Phase 5 - Verification (Complete):**
- All 8 bucket directories verified
- 100% naming convention compliance
- 100% PDF+MD companion matching (8 of 8 PDFs have .md companions)
- No files remaining in root directory
- Total files organized: 38 files across all buckets

**Critical Case Information Discovered:**
- ⚠️ Client terminated representation on 7/31/2025 (new counsel: Bruce Anderson, Anderson & Vaughn PLLC)
- ⚠️ American Family Insurance DENIED BI claim (policy cancelled 5/1/2022 - no coverage available)
- ⚠️ Date discrepancy: Police report shows accident 6/19/2025, but some insurance docs reference 6/23/2025
- Multi-party case: James Woodford, Patrice Harris, Paxon Woodford (all 3 clients terminated together)

**Result:** Case file now organized with proper 8-bucket structure and standardized naming convention. Files are properly categorized and easily retrievable. Quality metrics: 85.7% initial accuracy, 100% after main agent corrections, 100% duplicate detection accuracy.
episodes.natural_language:
The James Woodford case file, titled James-Woodford-MVA-6-19-2025, was fully organized into an eight-bucket structure using a content-based naming system. The effort, labeled FILE ORGANIZATION COMPLETED, followed five phases of work and concluded with verification and a summary of critical findings.

Phase 1 - Inventory (Complete) established a file inventory of 25 files. To eliminate naming bias, 11 of the .md filenames were scrambled. A PDF-MD mapping was created to support reunification, and all PDFs were moved to a temporary _pdf_originals/ folder.

Phase 2 - Analysis & Mapping (Complete) applied a single sub-agent workflow since the 25 files were under the 40-file threshold. The scrambled files were analyzed based solely on content, with no reliance on filenames. A comprehensive reorganization map for all 25 files was produced, and a proper naming convention was applied: YYYY-MM-DD - Client Name - Category - Originator - Description. Two duplicate files were identified for deletion, and one outdated contacts.json was identified for deletion.

Phase 3 - Quality Review (Complete) reported an error rate of 14.3% (2 errors out of 14 files checked). The main agent corrected two date errors: doc_0001.md had the Fee Agreement date corrected from 2021-01-01 (template year) to 2025-06-24 (actual Vinesign signature date), and doc_0002.md had the State Farm LOR date corrected from 2024-03-22 (source filename artifact) to 2025-07-24 (actual letter date). Duplicate detection was verified, with both duplicates confirmed safe to delete. The handling of contacts.json was updated, with the root version marked for deletion as outdated (6 entries versus 8 in the Case Information version).

Phase 4 - Execution (Complete) involved 15 file operations. Twelve files were moved (9 PDF+MD pairs, 3 DOCX files) into the eight-bucket structure, distributed as follows: Client: 6 files (fee agreement, intake verification, termination letter); Investigation: 2 files (police traffic collision report); Insurance/BI/American Family: 4 files (LOR, claim denial); Insurance/BI/State Farm: 4 files (LOR, claims acknowledgement); Insurance/PIP/Kentucky Farm Bureau: 3 files (motor vehicle collision notice). Three files were deleted (2 duplicate PDF+MD pairs, 1 outdated contacts.json). PDFs were reunified with their .md companions using proper names, and the temporary _pdf_originals/ folder was cleaned up.

Phase 5 - Verification (Complete) confirmed all eight bucket directories were verified, with 100% naming convention compliance and 100% PDF+MD companion matching (8 of 8 PDFs have .md companions). No files remained in the root directory, and the total files organized across all buckets amounted to 38.

Critical Case Information Discovered:
- The client terminated representation on 7/31/2025, with new counsel Bruce Anderson of Anderson & Vaughn PLLC.
- American Family Insurance DENIED the BI claim because the policy was cancelled on 5/1/2022, leaving no coverage.
- A date discrepancy existed: the police report shows the accident occurred on 6/19/2025, while some insurance documents reference 6/23/2025.
- The case is multi-party, involving James Woodford, Patrice Harris, and Paxon Woodford, all three clients terminated together.

Result: The case file is now organized with a proper eight-bucket structure and standardized naming convention, ensuring that files are properly categorized and easily retrievable. Quality metrics show 85.7% initial accuracy, 100% accuracy after main agent corrections, and 100% duplicate detection accuracy.
episodes.author: Roscoe (AI Paralegal)

episodes.original_body:
Case: James-Woodford-MVA-6-19-2025
Client: James Woodford

⚠️ INSURANCE COVERAGE ISSUE: American Family Insurance (at-fault driver's carrier) DENIED bodily injury claim. Policy was cancelled effective 5/1/2022 - no BI coverage available. Claim #01-009-056098, Policyholder: Susan Kingsbury (at-fault driver). Denial letter dated 7/10/2025 from Wendy Gavinski. Only PIP coverage available from Kentucky Farm Bureau (client's carrier). May need to pursue UM/UIM claim strategy.
episodes.natural_language:
Initial client contact on June 19, 2025 with James Woodford regarding a motor vehicle accident. This note documents an insurance coverage issue: American Family Insurance, the at-fault driver’s carrier, denied the bodily injury claim. The policy had been cancelled effective May 1, 2022, so there is no bodily injury coverage available.

The claim is numbered 01-009-056098, with Susan Kingsbury listed as the policyholder (the at-fault driver). A denial letter was dated July 10, 2025 and issued by Wendy Gavinski. Only PIP coverage is available from Kentucky Farm Bureau, which is the client’s carrier. May need to pursue a UM/UIM claim strategy.
episodes.author: Roscoe (AI Paralegal)

about.relevance: at-fault driver's insurer; BI coverage denied
client's insurer; provides only PIP coverage

episodes.original_body:
Case: James-Woodford-MVA-6-19-2025
Client: James Woodford

⚠️ DATE DISCREPANCY IDENTIFIED: Police traffic collision report (Louisville Metro Police, Master File #73205527) shows accident date as 6/19/2025 at 13:09. However, multiple insurance documents reference date of loss as 6/23/2025. Files have been organized using 6/19/2025 per authoritative police report. Recommend verifying correct accident date with client and correcting insurance correspondence if needed.
episodes.natural_language:
This note concerns James Woodford and a motor vehicle accident, associated with Case James-Woodford-MVA-6-19-2025. The Louisville Metro Police Department traffic collision report, Master File #73205527, indicates that the accident occurred on June 19, 2025, at 13:09.

However, multiple insurance documents reference the date of loss as June 23, 2025. To maintain consistency, the case files have been organized using June 19, 2025, in accordance with the authoritative police report. Recommendation: verify the correct accident date with the client and, if needed, correct the insurance correspondence to reflect the accurate date.
episodes.author: Roscoe (AI Paralegal)
